alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 8:39AM EST until January 19 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Northampton and Halifax Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Monday was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.8 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 04/02/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Tar River Tarboro 19.0 19.8 Mon 8 am EST 21.2 21.5 20.2 17.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 845 PM EST.
